headline: What you learn in this story
panels: This online learning unit will help you to understand how to use pictures from the internet.
You will get to know the difference between some rights, all rights and no rights reserved pictures and which information you need to provide in order to use them.
You will also learn about different tools and repositories that can help you find free to use pictures on the internet.
Find your own way through the game and be rewarded with a lot of helpful knowledge.
Ok, let’s learn how to use pictures from the internet without going to jail.

headline: Enter Your Name
panels: Hello. You are interested in learning about licenses? That’s great, you are at the right address.
But, how rude of me to be. I totally forgot to introduce myself. I am the Lawyerdude and I am here to help you.
Before we start our exciting journey through the beautiful world of licenses, what shall I call you?

headline: Introduction
panels: Okay, {username}.
Don’t worry. I know that there is a lot of confusion about using pictures from the internet. But it is actually not that complicated. Let’s just do it together, alright?
What brought you here anyway?
decisions: I found a nice picture online that I want to use. Can you show me how I do it correctly?
I am not sure where to look for a picture that I can use for my own purpose. Can you help me?

headline: Using pictures from the internet
panels: Great, let's find out if and how you can use a picture from the internet.
<INTRODUCTION TO LICENSE LAW>
Alright, I think you got to know the basics now. Do you know which case applies to your picture?
decisions: Phhh, that is way too complicated. I could just use the picture, nobody will ever find out anyway.
I don’t know, to be honest.
Forget about the picture! Isn’t there a way to get those free to use pictures you just talked about?

headline: Searching for pictures online
panels: Alright then. Let’s find a nice picture that fits your purpose.
<INTRODUCTION TO LICENSE LAW>
So, where do you want to look?
decisions: Google it.
I don’t know. You tell me!

headline: Understanding the Source
panels: No problem. I can help you to find all the information you need. First let’s start with the source of the picture
<Unterscheidung zwischen all rights und some rights reserved>
Where did you find your picture?
decisions: Seriously? I don't remember, I just downloaded it I guess.
On some page on the internet. I can show you!
Wikimedia Commons or Wikipedia.

headline: Using free licenses
panels: I know, you probably expect me to show you a magical way of finding pictures, that you can easily use. Well, there is something just like that.
<EXPLAINING REPOSITORIES>
decisions: Wow, tell me more!
I am not convinced. That sounds limited to me.

headline: Finding the copyright holder
panels: That’s good! The source of the picture is one of the components of the license notice.
Another very important thing is to know the copyright holder of the picture.
Do you know who created the picture?
decisions: I don’t care!
Of course!
No, I can not find any information on that.

headline: Using Wikimedia Commons 1
decisions: That’s it? So how do I use these pictures then?
Cool, that's very easy. Thanks for showing me where to get pictures without licenses!

headline: Finding the copyright information
panels: That’s good! The source of the picture is one of the components of the license notice.
Did the author provide information about the usage of the picture?
decisions: No! But I will use it anyway.
I don’t know. Where can I find this?
Yes, I already found out.

headline: Getting the licence
panels: Don't worry. I know that sometimes it can be difficult to find these information on a website.
Lawyerdude explains where licenses are placed typically
Let’s just try, if you can find the license information in the following examples.

headline: Using the licence
panels: Good. You collected all the information you need to create a license notice. Do you feel ready to learn how to do it?
decisions: Let me try it to find the license information again.
Sure.
I could not find the license information for my picture.

headline: Creating the licence notice
panels: Of course you need to create a license notice.
<CREATING A LICENSE NOTICE>
Good. Do you think you got everything together now?
decisions: Yes, let's go!
Actually, I’m not sure..

headline: Using the picture
panels: Great! Now you have all the information you need to use your picture from the internet without going to jail.
decisions: Not sure, tell me more.
Cool.

headline: More information
decisions: Ok, continue

headline: Success
panels: Well done! Now you can use the picture without going to jail. But there are more ways to get here. Do you want to learn more?
decisions: Thanks, that's enough licenses for now!
Tell me more.

headline: Finish
panels: <DISCLAIMER>

headline: Using search engines
panels: Google sure is a great place to find pictures online.
decisions: There must be something easier!
It cannot be that difficult..

headline: Using search engine tools
panels: Google helps you to find pictures under free licenses.
<Lawyerdude explains that there is a tool that helps to find pictures under free licenses>
Just try it yourself!

headline: Using Wikimedia Commons 2
panels: Of course you need to create a license notice for every picture you use from the internet.
<CREATING A LICENSE NOTICE>
But don't worry. There is a tool that helps you.

headline: Using Google
panels: Good. Now use you knowledge to find a nice picture that is free to use with the help of a search engine.
Whenever you feel like you found your picture, we can continue.
decisions: Wait, why are we doing this?
Alright, found one.

headline: Uh oh!
text: You're in jail. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum.
